body:
Hey Jeremy,

Thanks for pointing me to `class_attribute`, but it looks like because of the way headers are changed in practice, `class_attribute` actually creates a situation where child headers do leak upstream. (I don't know if leak is the right word here...but I think you know what I mean.)

Consider:

```ruby
class Base
  class_attribute :setting
end

class Subclass < Base
end

Base.setting = {}
Subclass.setting             # => {}
Subclass.setting['key'] =  'value'
Subclass.setting['key']     # => "value"
Base.setting['key']           # => "value" # uh-oh
```

This is how headers are set in ARes and it doesn't seem to gel with `class_attribute`. Any other ideas?
